title: Patch Chat with the Playtest Team - Patch 7.14
body:
https://news-a.akamaihd.net/public/na_images/PCHCHT/Minions.jpg
Header by inkiness

Hey, everyone! I'm Riot King Cobra and it's time for another round of Patch Chat! These threads serve as opportunity for us to talk about the patches that come out every two weeks. You can find the most recent patch by following this link: [Patch 7.14 Notes](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-714-notes).

I'm on Riot's Playtest Team, a group of high elo players who play with the new champions, reworks, balance tweaks, items, and map updates before they are released. It's our job to the test the changes that our designers come up with and ensure that we're introducing positive changes to League in terms of both balance and fun. Ask us questions - we'll try to answer as many as we can!

Kayn, the Shadow Reaper arrives to the Rift in Patch 7.14 along with a number of other changes. Alistar's ultimate has received a buff to the damage reduction he gets from it, Caitlyn's attack speed growth has been lowered more, Cho'Gath, Diana, and Singed have all received a small amount of gameplay changes, and a number of other champions in need of attention have as well. In addition to champion changes, a number of items have changed as well - we made modifications to Thornmail, Randuin's, and some of the Lethality items. 

All of us on the Playtest Team are avid gamers so feel free to talk to us as fellow LoL players!

Ben “Cezium” Burkhardt
Don “Aesah” Ding
Dan “penguin” Hardison
Robert “ROBERTxLEE” Lee
Rob "King Cobra" Rosa
Nicholas “Nickwu” Smith
Blake “S0be” Soberanis
Trevor “ThEntropist” Thernes
Arnor "Hjarta" Halldorsson
Brian "Madness Heroo" Pressoir

replies.body: are syndra and orianna set for nerfs? Im really tired of seeing them in every pro game
I share your opinion that these champions are stifling for the midlane meta (along with Taliyah in Pro) but don't believe we have plans to nerf them currently.

Unironically, a place you might be able to shave stats off for free on Syndra is 5-10 points off her Q's base damage.

The AP ratio increase to compensate for the loss of her +15% damage passive did a weird thing to her Q's power curve in 6.9. She received a damage *increase* levels 1-4 thanks to the AP ratio buff. She then immediately suffers a damage *decrease* at level 5 until around 575 AP--or, practically equivalent at around 450 AP, then equal at 575, and a buff past that. So, her early game Q was improved (something that was pointedly stripped away from her in the past before) by around 5-15 points of damage off the AP ratio. While stripping the base damage doesn't neatly clean that up, and she'll still get *some* benefit unless it's an overkill nerf, it won't be as nearly as impactful as it is currently.
Appreciate the post (as always, love reading your Syndra analysis). Will forward this and see what they think & if they want to continue the discussion.
Ah, thank you. You're welcome to poke me for anything else that comes to mind in that regard.

hey guys, what is the reasoning behind the two pretty hefty anivia nerfs? the wall not granting vision really messes with many of her core strategies including making picks in jungle or trying to secure objectives. Is there a specific reasoning behind this drastic nerf that will 100% affect her play style and win rate? Also, why the changes to her R in the bugfix section? This has been like this for quite a long while, why change it now? and can we make ability specific nerfs appear in the champion section, rather than the bugfix one? obviously the swain crows from fountain are a bug fix but the changes to anivia's R are a nerf.

Here's a quote from the live gameplay designer who generally works on Anivia. I believe these are framework-esque changes that will likely affect more champions in the future. Quote:

"The vision changes were a part of a more comprehensive look at how abilities and vision function in the game. We aren't done with the vision changes yet, but this was a good first step.
We feel like champions with incidental vision granting abilities do not have to take sufficient risks and makes for a worse game holistically (champions being forced to facecheck or pay a set cost [eg. use a ward]) is something that we feel all champions should be held to, unless their abilities explicitly allow them to bypass this (eg. hawkshot).
For reference, I didn't make this change, but OK'd it."

-- phroxz0n

Hi Meddler,
How do you feel about the current state of Ryze?
Will there be some balance changes in the near future?

Not Meddler, but I personally think Ryze is on the weak side (at least in solo queue). He sees a little bit of play in competitive because his ultimate lends itself well to that environment.

Not sure about balance changes in the near future.

How about just give him a base damage buff bit by bit until his winrate stabilize? And then save any future rework idea for Ryze on another champion? And make him a Yordle student of Ryze wanting to steal his scroll from him to explain the similarities in their kits?
Thoughts on Malz?
He's strong IMO. Not much else to say, I'm happy that he's not a support anymore.

Okay, playtest team, a couple of softballs for you.

First, what balance change this patch do you feel was most impactful? Most important?

Second, toplaners, how do you feel about the prospective Nasus changes on the PBE?
Most impactful was probably Singed. He's crazy powerful rn.
If you know that he would be THAT strong, why is he still in the patch without lowering numbers ??
I didn't know he would be that strong. I thought he was strong, but definitely not hotfix-territory strong. I made a mistake, no real way of sugarcoating it.
I have seen post in the past that there would be a desire for looking into discouraging the proxy playstyle of singed, but these changes are extremely direct buffs to that playstyle
It wasn't a part of the goals to stop singed from proxying with these changes. It was just to make him a more functional, modernized champion.

Thanks for admitting it tho :)
Glad he was hotfixed

Meddler already confirmed Singed's getting hotfixed.

They didn't know he would be this strong, this is just their assessment of Singed's statistics now that the patch has been out for several hours.

How is kindred's current state in the game? I find that she is not very strong unless she gets a few lucky marks or until she has 2 crit items plus jungle item. Not sure if I'm just bad with her or if the meta does not favor her or she is under powered in general.
Internal stats generally indicate she's finally in a decent spot after our last round of buffs.
*they ;)
Since Meddler suggested that y'all are going to start looking to bring almost-viable champions up in the pro-scene, should we mortals be worried about the possibility of Rengar/Graves buffs?
I wonder just how many champions would be seriously OP in soloqueue if all champions were made LCS-viable. I honestly think that only a handful would have winrates above 55%.

You kidding?

Something like 60 or 70 champs see no competitive play, last I heard about it (maybe it has changed this last season, but I doubt it).

If you had to buff all those 60+ champs so that they are viable in Pro-play, at least half of them would need to go far above 55% winrate in Gold and below.

60 or 70? [Try 6](https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/6iqd2g/fun_fact_only_6_champions_have_not_been_picked/?ref=search_posts). Although I'm sure the number is much higher if you count champions that weren't played more than once.

OK fair enough, I should have qualified my post better. Still, not to sound too dismissive, but being played once in one of the less competitive regions doesn't exactly sound the same as "LCS-viable" (your term) to my ears. ^^'
Howdy howdy guys, my question for you all is about Urgot if you don't mind. How does he feel, do you think he still feels like Urgot, any runes, masteries and builds?
in addition to the above, why are his AAs the way they are on his W? Just seems better to attack move, proc the passive normally, and not get slowed.
3.0 attack speed, and you don't have to stop moving to attack.

With every new champion and rework, do you try to make them equally viable in soloqueue and competitive? Do you try to avoid making champions like Azir, old Katarina, Garen, or new Ryze, who are trash or godlike depending on your elo?

We try to push them in that direction yes, but if we're doing smaller scale reworks like Malzahar/Rek'Sai rather than a full Gameplay Update, we often don't have the bandwith to change the things that cause these imbalances.

Quite a few questions here...
1) first thoughts on new {{item:3075}}? looks like it has everything to me, hp ton of armor grevious wounds and as slow
2) the {{champion:33}}  {{item:3075}} combo destroying enemies with {{item:3075}}  damage plus W thanks to grevious wounds is being looked at? and if yes opinions on it.
3)  {{item:3147}} passive changed to physical damage working too well with {{champion:238}} is something planned or?
4) how is {{champion:141}} seen him only a bunch of times but everyone is playing shadow assassin form, was it just in my games or it's a confirmable thing, if yes you think rhaast is too weak or shadow too strong?
5) Was a nerf to {{item:3142}} really necessary? having more speed sure is useful but all lethality items now lack AD
6){{item:3147}} used to encourage lethality stacking with its passive, was that deliberately removed to avoid this stacking or?
7) thoughts on {{champion:18}}  even if the last buff was on 7.3 recently she is having a great rise and is now one of the best adcs in the meta, plans for her? 
8) i know it's not a big focus as runes and mastery will soon get canges but after Deathfire Touch nerfs on AD ratio no ad champ has ever used it, not even {{champion:202}}  that with his ad would be the one with the most profit, is it ok or just none cares as soon the whole system will change?

1) I think it's a strong item but not overpowered. Bramble Vest is higher impact IMO for how it changes some matchup dynamics.
2) The new Thornmail does less reflect damage, and most targets don't have significant healing. I think this makes Rammus do less damage overall.
3) We didn't change it to physical damage for that reason specifically but we were aware of the interaction, Zed was on the weak side beforehand so we think it's fine.
4) I think Kayn is fine but will take players some getting used to. Both forms have their place and IMO Slayer is slightly stronger, but assassin is much higher skill cap so Slayer will probably appear significantly stronger for a while.
5) I think this was generally a power neutral or slight buff change to Ghostblade with the Lethality scaling changes, extra MS, and extra Lethality
6) We wanted to make it a more attractive first item so making it require you to have other sources of Lethality didn't really make sense.
7) She's strong atm, not sure to the point she needs nerfs.
8) I agree that the DFT nerfs to AD went too far and the issue at the time was more Lethality items. As you said considering the system is going away at the end of the season I'm not sure it's worth trying to balance this specific point at this juncture.

Currently on the PBE, Akali is getting a small buff to her W CD, 20s to 18s. What is the intention behind this change? Akali currently right for mains is doing fine, so this is a random buff that doesn't really do anything and frankly doesn't need?

Why is lethality back to being a snowball mechanic? Why is it not limited to melee champs or halved for ranged champs? I don't think the stat has been balanced since release, and the pendulum just swung back again this patch.

Well, tried before the patch that went out 7.14 regarding the Diana changes.  After playing with her for a few days,  her early game took quite the hit.  particularly jungle and top lane as I feared.  In jungle, she doesn't stay as healthy.  Keep in mind I don't do the Penetration runes very much anymore, mainly attack speed.  her kit at level 2 is underwhelming as you would often throw your q and w in rapid succession, so, trying to play the mini game to keep her new passive going  is annoying.  Net loss to her jungling ability, which as you may know, she tends to power farm till 6.  Her pre 6 trading and dueling took hits as well in lane phase, most notably in the top lane.  I would go back to static 20% attack speed, leave the mana gain on third hit cleave, as you did nerf the Doran's rings she fairly famously used in multiples, as it is better for penetration builds as well as attack speed builds. The extra attack speed off her other abilities on e hasn't really come into play much yet that I have seen.  Again, on spellblade champions, Jax, Irelia, Diana, Fizz, Ezreal, etc, quite often you can't quite maximize their spellblade procs as much as one would like.  It is generally better to throw what you have when you can, her new passive feels really bad when I do a catch combo on her as I thought it would.  But, those rare times where you get to hit the rift scuttle 2 times then, dive into the enemy team and feel quite glorious at the instant triple kill, or more.

Also the odd attack damage runes which I have been experimenting more of lately, that was a rarity I did with her as well as full tank Diana on occasion, may become the norm with her the old Titanic Trinity Force builds work well on her as an ad bruiser, since her ap bruiser is basically nerfed down horribly.  She really misses the early Negatron Cloak for the Old Abyssal Scepter for early tankiness and survivability mid lane in particular.   Twisted Treeline, she is oddly ok with MoonFlair spellblade servicing both her armor and magic resist needs, but, generally you are more concerned with the Rift rather than anywhere else.

The vision score, which was implemented a couple patches ago, is very very useful. It made me realise, that vision is much more important than just putting down stealth wards. I started buying pink wards not long after that. You should keep adding more to the stats page, to raise awareness between players, at least among those who commit energy post-game, and are browsing through the stats. Keep up the good work!
